intro: Psychotria calva var. cicatricosa, commonly known as the scarred psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with distinctive white spots and a scar-like mark on the underside, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. This plant is often found in shaded, humid environments within tropical forests.
